abstracts.cdata!:
This Structural Adjustment Loan Project
            will provide necessary assistance to the Lithuanian
            Government in the implementation of its structural reform
            program. Its objective is to put the economy on a path of
            rapid and sustainable growth, as a means to permanently
            reduce poverty. At present, reaching that path requires: 1)
            solving the banking system's current operational and
            under-capitalization problems; and 2) eliminating the most
            serious sectoral imbalances in the rest of the economy
            especially in the energy, agriculture and social security
            sectors. The project will provide the Lithuanian Government
            with critical financial support to cover the short term
            costs associated with the cross-sectoral reforms needed in
            order to continue the transition toward a market economy.
            The project is divided into two equal tranches of 40 million
            (US dollars) the second of which is to be disbursed upon
            satisfaction of release conditions.
